definition: lit. body and soul separated (idiom); fig. scared out of one's wits/beside oneself
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached

sentences.english: I was so scared that my blood ran cold .
sentences.chinese: 我真是给吓得手脚冰冷，魂不附体。

sentences.english: Defending murderers and thieves would appall them.
sentences.chinese: 为杀人犯和小偷辩护会使他们吓得魂不附体。

sentences.english: For the first time in my life, I was terrified by a beautiful sunrise.
sentences.chinese: 我平生第一次被美丽的日出吓得魂不附体。

sentences.english: A mouse scared her out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 一只老鼠把她吓得魂不附体。

sentences.english: To her horror, she saw her husband knocked down by a truck.
sentences.chinese: 见到丈夫被一辆卡车撞到在地，她吓得魂不附体。

sentences.english: A sudden shout scared her out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 一阵突然的叫声吓得她魂不附体。

sentences.english: The little girl cried when she saw her dying cat.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩看到那条蛇的时候，吓得魂不附体。

sentences.english: In their panic and utter dejection, the apostles had not thought about it at all.
sentences.chinese: 惊吓得魂不附体的宗徒们，根本没有顾及到那么多。

sentences.english: A miserable shout from nobody-knew-where scared him out of his wits.
sentences.chinese: 哪里传来了一声惨嚎，吓得他魂不附体。

sentences.english: She was scared out of wits.
He could hear a sudden roaring. His blood froze .
sentences.chinese: 他听到突如其来的一声吼叫，吓得魂不附体。

sentences.english: The pupils were terrified out of their senses.
sentences.chinese: 小学生们被吓得魂不附体。

definition: to be scared out of one's wits (idiom)
scared out of one's wits (idiom); in a panic
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
